Articles.Content:
I was making a little quadrocopter kinda thing with rcs engines, but when launched, the physics-less parts decouple them self and start acting ape.... ... The kraken force of it shoots the kerbal on a suborbital trajectory

The fueltanks are magically teleported under the launch platform and use their telekinetic powers to provide fuel to the engines!
Oh my DERP! I've always loved this idea for KSP. I hope the devs never add a patch for this.

It's got something to do with the physics less parts like the tiny steel girders and rcs engines connected to a control seat.

The kerbal gets wedges between the fuel tanks and then gets spat out at a ludicrous speed the kerbal gets instant shock waves and re-entry effects!
